Wine.Description: A soft touch of lemon and green pear creates an appetizing nose. The palate has a salty tang on its smooth, balanced and fruity body. Easy and light, this is perfect as a refreshing, versatile white.

Wine.Name: Fischer 2016 Ried Zanzl Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
Wine.Description: Spicy notes of miso and yeast appear first on the nose. The palate, full with vivid spritz, amplifies them even more. Bright lemon notes provide freshness, createing a lively, almost warming but still refreshing Grüner that is all about total savoriness, spice and verve.

Wine.Name: Alma Rosa 2006 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
Wine.Description: Though an accidental opening in a blind tasting, this wine was stellar a decade old, easily rising above its current counterparts. Extremely complex and savory aromas of au jus sauce, porcini mushrooms, charred beef, black olive, mulberry and hearty black plum give way to a mushroom-laden palate. Black truffle, baked cranberry, underbrush and rugged but refined earthiness shine on the sip.

Wine.Name: StoneCap 2010 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
Wine.Description: Very young, this is a fine follow-up to the winery's outstanding 2009. Dark and rich, the estate-grown fruit offers far more flavor than almost any domestic Merlot in this price range. Blackberries, black cherry, smoke and espresso lead into a grainy, chocolaty, tannic finish.

Wine.Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2013 Cannubi (Barolo)
Wine.Description: Tight and focused, this opens with aromas of wild berry, red rose, culinary spice and a whisper of menthol. Chiseled and austere, the palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate, white pepper and a hint of anise. Youthfully assertive fine-grained tannins and bright acidity provide the framework. Give it time to soften and fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.

Wine.Name: Bach NV Gran Brut Sparkling (Cava)
Wine.Description: Straightforward apple and spice aromas draw you in. The palate on this value-priced brut Cava is fresh and focused, with mango, citrus, spice and dried herb flavors. It finishes fresh, with a touch of quince and apple flavor. Good for the price.

Wine.Name: Santa Luz 2015 Alba Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
Wine.Description: Gritty citrus aromas are oily but adequate. This basic SB tastes of citrus and green vegetables. Beyond that, it's mostly fresh in feel.

Wine.Name: Tiziano Mazzoni 2011 Dei Mazzoni (Ghemme)
Wine.Description: Elegantly structured, this offers floral, wild berry and spice aromas. The focused palate delivers bright red cherry, crushed raspberry, leather, white pepper and licorice flavors presented with laser-like precision. Chewy but fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provide the framework. It's already tempting but it's not fully developed. Drink 2016–2026.

Wine.Name: Parducci 2009 True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
Wine.Description: Unexpectedly aromatic in jasmine and rose, Parducci's True Grit is otherwise big with a coated mouthfeel of leather, amidst a wall of toned tannins.

Wine.Name: Cellers Unió 2011 Roureda Llicorella Gran Selecció Vitis 60 Grenache-Carignan (Priorat)
Wine.Description: Smooth, integrated aromas of cookie dough, forest floor and briary berry fruits lead to a palate that's plump on the edges but more intense and pulling in the middle. Flavors of ripe berry fruits, vanilla and tobacco finish with dry tannins and bold acidity, meaning this has more gas in the tank; drink through 2024.

Wine.Name: Vision Cellars 2006 Las Alturas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
Wine.Description: Too big by far for a Pinot Noir, this single-vineyard bottling is heavy-handed. It has caramelized cherry and blackberry fruit flavors and a soft, candied quality. Ultimately, it lacks the elegance and delicacy of a fine wine.

Wine.Name: Arrowood 2009 Alary Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
Wine.Description: Here's a smooth, creamy Chardonnay for drinking now. It has good weight, with a deep center of citrus, peach and buttered toast flavors. Russian River Valley acidity makes it racy and clean.

Wine.Name: Au Contraire 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
Wine.Description: A soft, pillowy wine with a velvety texture, this crowd-pleaser exudes coastal characteristics of forest floor, dark cherry and rhubarb, providing enough body to complement its lightness of being.

Wine.Name: King Estate 2014 Unity King Estate Vineyard-Pfeiffer Vineyards Pinot Gris (Oregon)
Wine.Description: Sourced 60% from the King Estate Vineyard and 40% from the Pfeiffer Vineyards, this sports lovely scents of melon, grapefruit and pear, with accents of sweet grain. Flavors follow in lockstep, with the juicy grapefruit taking the lead, along with tongue-tickling acids.

Wine.Name: Don Miguel Gascón 2006 Gascón Malbec (Mendoza)
Wine.Description: Getting past the giant blast of oak that dominates the bouquet is not an easy task, but the intrepid wood chopper will find another side to this wine, one that's full of bright, juicy black fruit and syrupy core sweetness. Of course, the oak is always present and with that comes mocha, coffee and vanilla notes. Imported by Gascon USA.

Wine.Name: Bouvet-Ladubay 2009 Saphir Brut (Saumur)
Wine.Description: Big, rich and creamy, this has white and yellow fruits and a full-bodied mouthfeel. It is ripe and rounded, with its acidity showing through to the finish. It needs a year in the bottle.

Wine.Name: L'original French Kiss 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
Wine.Description: This wine has soft flavors, fruity and bright, with a light, easygoing character that will sip down easily. Drink immediately, well chilled.

Wine.Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2015 Kirchweg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
Wine.Description: An appetizing top note of candied lemon peel hovers over the glass before spicy hints of pear peel become apparent. The palate is edged with very precise zesty grapefruit hints that frame and corset a most generously white-pepper-spiced host of pear and yellow plum fruit. It is the structure of that zesty acidity that make this luminous and appetizing. This is rich but concentrated; delicious now but built to last. Drink 2017–2035.

Wine.Name: Nicolucci 2013 Vigna del generale Predappio di Predappio Sangiovese (Romagna)
Wine.Description: This opens with aromas suggesting blackberry, underbrush and a whiff of new leather. The concentrated, savory palate shows black cherry, tobacco and white pepper alongside lithe tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
Wine.Vineyard: Vigna del generale Predappio di Predappio

Wine.Name: Oak Summit 2005 Pinot Noir (Hudson River Region)
Wine.Description: Sprays of rose petals and violets mingle decadently with notes of brandy-soaked cherries on this deliciously juicy Pinot Noir. Dry, yet densely concentrated in fruit, its bright acidity carries towards a soft, candy-coated cherry finish.

Wine.Name: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2010 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru (Chablis)
Wine.Description: With wood-based aromas, this is currently a closed, taut wine. It has green fruits and minerality; it's nervy and under tension. The acidity is crisp while very light in character. This is for aging.

Wine.Name: Casas del Bosque 2013 Late Harvest Riesling (Casablanca Valley)
Wine.Description: Honeyed aromas of wheat bread and stone fruits are not as convincing as the wine's citrus, melon and honey flavors, which are supported by a full almost-sticky body. A creamy, chunky finish, like the palate, pulls up short of sticky.

Wine.Name: Valerie Hill 2011 Chardonnay (Shenandoah Valley)
Wine.Description: A hint of sulfur quickly gives way to aromas of Meyer lemon, mineral and yellow nectarine. Silky in texture, the wine feels lax on entrance but the acidity brightens toward the finish.

Wine.Name: Caves Transmontanas 2012 Quanta Terra Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
Wine.Description: Full of red fruits and generous tannins, this is an immediately attractive wine. The red-berry fruits are balanced by good acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2017 to allow the tannins to soften further.

Wine.Name: Kuleto Estate 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
Wine.Description: A strong, oaky Chardonnay. Lacks subtlety and interest, but if you're looking for sheer power, it's for you. Shows pineapple jam, buttered toast and caramel flavors.

Wine.Name: Keller Estate 2013 El Coro Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
Wine.Description: Sandalwood and a shovelful of fresh earth mark the entry of this wine aromatically. A soft, tart expression of the variety, it offers bittersweet tannin and dark cherry at its core.

Wine.Name: Fetzer 2014 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)
Wine.Description: This is an appealing, dry, and well-balanced wine, with everything in good proportions. It has lots of fresh cherry aromas, good and deep fruit flavors and a light but tasty layer of toasted, smoky oak.

Wine.Name: Ghost Pines 2013 Winemaker's Blend Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County)
Wine.Description: Damp forest and dried cherry with cranberry combine on the nose and palate in this wine, sourced predominantly from Monterey County. Soft and silky it risks veering off balance once the oak begins to unwrap, becoming quite burly on the finish.

Wine.Name: Serni Fulvio Luigi 2009 Acciderba (Bolgheri)
Wine.Description: This Acciderba shows elegance and intensity, and it offers notes of oak-derived spice, dried herb, blackberry and clove. On the palate, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Sangiovese delivers firm tannins and tangy barbecue and teriyaki notes.

Wine.Name: McWilliam's 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Hilltops)
Wine.Description: The Hilltops is a high-altitude (approximately 450 meters above sea level), continental region that's often a good source for value. This wine is crisp, youthful and firm, with hints of baking spices and vanilla accenting pure cassis fruit. Drink 2020–2030.

Wine.Name: Terenzi 2008 Francesca Romana (Maremma Toscana)
Wine.Description: This blend of Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon shows remarkable richness and smoothness. It delivers bright, fresh tones of black cherry and blackberry that are backed by touches of leather and tobacco. It's velvety and taut, not too heavy or extracted.

Wine.Name: Devaux NV Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
Wine.Description: As befits a 100% Pinot Noir wine, this is a rich Champagne, poised between ripe apricot and pear fruits and more mineral acidity. Just a touch of tannin adds structure to this ready-to-drink wine.

Wine.Name: Steiner Family Vineyards 2012 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
Wine.Description: Almost black in color, this full-bodied wine is bold in aroma, smelling like black pepper and blackberry, with a slightly earthy edge. It tastes dense, rich but dry. A thick coat of tannins leads to an astringent finish.

Wine.Name: Origin 2009 Malbec (Mendoza)
Wine.Description: Citric smelling, with floral notes and dampness. The palate is more thin and grating than expected, with red fruit, citrus, cherry sucking candy and graham cracker flavors. Finishes a bit edgy and candied, and overall it's generic with little personality.

Wine.Name: Heinrich 2013 Goldberg Reserve Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
Wine.Description: This is still tightly closed: There are merely some notions of iron oxide on the nose, but otherwise this is brooding and mysterious. The palate, however, has something majestic and sumptuous about it—a warm heart of ripe and aromatic black and red cherry. This just needs to breathe and will unfurl like crimson velvet on your tongue. While this can be approached now as it is beginning to mellow, this will be even better in the years leading up to 2020. Very moreish.

Wine.Name: Mattina Fiore 2011 Murmur Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
Wine.Description: Cola, beef jerky, roasted meats and dried purple berries hit initially the nose, follow by aromatic woods and black pepper. The flavors are distinctly interesting, with sandalwood, stewed plums, peppered chocolate, soy-braised beef and a tiny bit of reductive tar.

Wine.Name: Blessing 2009 Split Rock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
Wine.Description: Shows the silky dryness and elegance you want in a Pinot Noir, with brisk acidity framing sour cherry, pomegranate and persimmon fruit flavors. Really grows on you as it sits in the glass, warming up and developing complexity. The vineyard has been quite a successful source of grapes to several wineries, including Blessing.

Wine.Name: Fossil Point 2014 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
Wine.Description: This lower-priced Pinot from the Center of Effort team punches way above its weight in this vintage, showing light cherry-blossom and black-cherry aromas mixed with gamy meat and wet slate. Blackberry pie is cut with orange rind on the sip, with an earthy grip showing flavors of juniper, crushed clove and pipe tobacco.

Wine.Name: Giovanni Rosso 2006 Serralunga (Barolo)
Wine.Description: Giovanni Rosso's Barolo Serralunga opens with bright intensity and lively aromas of black cherry, raspberry, smoke, mineral, red rose, licorice and root beer. Those floral-rose nuances are especially beautiful and the wine should age at least five more years so that the tannins soften.

Wine.Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2013 Flood Family Vineyards Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
Wine.Description: A complete package, this shows lavender, smoke, boysenberry and black raspberry aromas on the nose. Plenty of acidity appears on the palate, where black pepper, white pepper, thyme and bay leaf spice up the tight blackberry core, finishing on a slightly caramelized note.

Wine.Name: Terlato 2011 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)
Wine.Description: Ripe and forward with Meyer lemon, lime, green apple and honeysuckle flavors. The finish is off dry and zesty in acidity. What an easy wine to drink with Asian, Ethiopian, Indian or Mexican fare, or by itself as a cocktail sipper.

Wine.Name: Spell 2013 Alder Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
Wine.Description: This wine is massively fruity and grandly structured without being heavy or overpowering, but it will need time for the firm tannins to mellow. It smells and tastes like pure, concentrated black cherry and feels full of fine-grained tannins and sour-cherry crispness. It will be best after 2020.

Wine.Name: Château de Gaudou 2013 Grande Lignée Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
Wine.Description: With 14 months oak aging, this structured, spicy wine shows considerable toast. A strongly smoky character is freshened by the red currant and blackberry fruitiness. Acidity gives the wine a lift and also promises aging. Drink from 2017.

Wine.Name: Château la Croix Blanche 2015 Bordeaux
Wine.Description: This is finely balanced wine. It has poise and bright red fruits. Underneath that are both tannins and crisp acidity. The wine is never heavy—it's well structured, finishing with swathes of fruits. Drink from late 2017.

Wine.Name: Bota Box 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)
Wine.Description: This light-bodied, dry wine smells fresh and fruity, tastes like crisp apples and honeydew melon, and has a soft texture that makes it easy to sip.

Wine.Name: Mira 2010 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
Wine.Description: Winemaker Gustavo Gonzalez left Robert Mondavi to do his own thing, and what an auspicious start. He's taken fruit from this historic Carneros vineyard and crafted a big and bold yet balanced Pinot filled with lusciousness. The flavors are enormously complex, ranging from fresh raspberry jam and cranberries to red currants and persimmons. Earthy cola, mushroom and forest floor notes add complexity. The acid-tannin balance is just about perfect. Good as it is, this compelling Pinot should develop well over the next six years.

Wine.Name: Astrales 2013 Christina (Ribera del Duero)
Wine.Description: Leathery, clipped, briary black-fruit aromas are heavily oaked and smoky. This feels like a bag of nails, with a sucking texture. Barrel-heavy flavors of charred blackberry and cassis are resiny and dry, with clove notes and pounding tannins. Hold as long as you wish; this can only benefit from more time in the bottle.

Wine.Name: Tegernseerhof 2013 Steinertal Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)
Wine.Description: Still closed, this emanates earthy notes at first while the palate shows pink grapefruit zest hugged by very ripe, lemon-toned peach with tropical overtones of fresh and canned pineapple. A textural, structure-giving phenolic element on the midpalate leads to an earth- and lemon-tinged pineapple finish.

Wine.Name: Sedition 2013 Chenoweth Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
Wine.Description: A new effort from Jigar Vineyards, sourcing some very good grapes, Sedition is light, clear and lingering on the palate in cherry-cola, mint and dried herb. Balanced and on the lighter side in terms of body and tannin, it's ready for the table, with a juicy, persistent finish.

Wine.Name: Rignana 2010 Riserva (Chianti Classico)
Wine.Description: This blend of 85% Sangiovese and 15% Merlot is heavy on oak. It starts with aromas of toasted oak, coffee and vanilla with just a whiff of black plum. The palate is also dominated by oak extract, chocolate and espresso that muffle the ripe, black fruit gasping beneath the surface. It closes on a bitter note of wood tannins.

Wine.Name: Carr 2007 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
Wine.Description: Too sweet and oaky to earn a higher score. It's rich and jammy in sugary raspberries and cherries, with lots of caramel and buttered toast. Ready now.

Wine.Name: Marqués de Irún 2007 Verdejo (Rueda)
Wine.Description: Peach, citrus and other simple but pure aromas give this Verdejo a proper if somewhat rote opening. The palate is tangy and cleansing, with lemon and apple in the lead. Finishes a bit acidic, but with freshness and a clean get-away. A Europvin, Christopher Cannan selection, imported by multiple importers, including Michael Skurnik Wines.

Wine.Name: Magnum Vinhos 2012 Maria Mora White (Alentejano)
Wine.Description: This rich, full-bodied wine has some acidity, although the palate is dominated by creamy yellow fruits and a yeasty character at the end.

Wine.Name: H. Billiot Fils NV Brut Rosé (Champagne)
Wine.Description: This soft style contains a warm, crushed strawberry flavor and ripe acidity, which creates a warm and rounded feel. The wine an edge of bitterness to to a slight hint of tannin. Disgorged November 2011.

Wine.Name: Gianni Brunelli 2005 Brunello di Montalcino
Wine.Description: Gianni Brunelli's elegant Brunello opens with a bright ruby color and a lean, tonic appearance. Yet the aromas of cherry, anise seed and wild flowers are intense and beautiful. The mouthfeel is streamlined and compact.

Wine.Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2014 Pessac-Léognan
Wine.Description: Tangy and zesty, this is a crisp wine. It has tight acidity and a strongly citrus character. There are bright gooseberry and herbal flavors that show strongly. The downside is it is one-dimensional: all herbal fruit and crisp acidity. Drink from 2020.

Wine.Name: Clearwater Canyon 2010 Verhey Vineyards Malbec (Washington)
Wine.Description: The oak is at the fore here with notes of pine and wood spice along with blue berry. The concentration is good but the tannins seem a bit dry and the alcohol lingers.

Wine.Name: Domaine Chasselay 2011 La Platière (Beaujolais)
Wine.Description: For a simple Beaujolais, this has richness and fruit density. It's as fruity as the wine should be, but it also has firm tannins. The finish has a minerally texture along with black-currant-like acidity.

Wine.Name: La Cignozza 2011 Chianti
Wine.Description: Aromas of red berry, sunbaked earth and crushed blue flower lead the nose. The easy-drinking palate offers mature wild cherry, white pepper and anise alongside polished tannins. It's simple but savory. Drink through 2016.

Wine.Name: Rutini 2007 Trumpeter Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
Wine.Description: Clean and well made, but underwhelming. There's basic blueberry and blackberry flavors riding on a medium-bodied palate, but overall the wine is more generic than specific. It's easygoing and causes no red flags to go up, however at the end of the day it doesn't show much personality.

Wine.Name: Trenza 2008 Blanco White (Edna Valley)
Wine.Description: A wonderfully rewarding wine. It shows the dryness and crisp acidity you want in a savory white, and the fruit flavors, of peaches, grapefruits and green apples, are controlled and subtle. There's just a touch of oak, which adds softness, and of creamy lees. Brilliant and distinctive. Albariño and Grenache Blanc.

Wine.Name: Ahlgren 2007 Bates Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
Wine.Description: Lots of berry, cherry and currant fruit in this dry Cabernet, which is drinking nice and mellow. It could be more concentrated, as it falls off in the finish, turning bitter.

Wine.Name: Herdade da Comporta 2010 Comporta Alicante Bouschet (Península de Setúbal)
Wine.Description: The red-juice grape Alicante Bouschet gives a fine performance here. It has produced a firm, structured wine with fine tannins as well as generous black fruit. It comes from a hot year in the region, producing great ripe, sweet fruit as well as intense acidity. The wine is just now ready to drink and will still mature further, at least until 2022.

Wine.Name: Oakville East 2010 Exposure Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
Wine.Description: Mainly Cabernet, it shows the variety's hard tannins and and black currant and dark chocolate flavors, but 21% Cabernet Franc adds easier notes of sweet cherry jam. Still, it's pretty tannic, and suggests aging until 2021–2022.

Wine.Name: Spangler Vineyards 2006 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)
Wine.Description: Chewy, earthy and tannic, this rather awkward wine matches cranberry and black cherry hard candy fruit to a rough, stemmy underbelly. There is some leather and barnyard in the middle; all in all it's a bit of a rough ride.

Wine.Name: Zuccardi 2011 Tito Red (La Consulta)
Wine.Description: Intense, focused and also quite floral on the nose, this blend of Malbec, Cab Sauvignon and the Italian variety Ancellotta is all about the fruit. Flavors of fig, blackberry and cassis ride nicely on a smooth, chewy palate. On the finish, this is layered, deep in feel and toasty in flavor. Drink this impressive, full-bodied blend now through 2018.

Wine.Name: Envy 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
Wine.Description: Envy has a very consistent track record with this bottling. The 2011 is typical of the house style, off-dry and honeyed, with pleasant citrus and grass flavors that veer into riper tropical fruits.

Wine.Name: Cono Sur 2001 Reserve Merlot (Rapel Valley)
Wine.Description: Bright violet in color and well extracted, but also vegetal. You'd think from the hue and vintage that it would be seamlessly ripe, but it seems green at the core. Thus while it delivers texture, rich plum fruit and tannic structure, there's a gap in clarity of fruit flavor.

Wine.Name: Banrock Station 2001 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)
Wine.Description: Good party Chard. Nothing too complex or subtle, just mixed tropical fruit with a hint of wood and sweet fruit-cocktail flavors.

Wine.Name: Sweet Cheeks 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
Wine.Description: Young and snappy with crisp green apple fruit flavors, this racy and nicely textured Pinot Gris shows excellent balance, concentration and length. Delicious now and should improve through 2017.

Wine.Name: Viticcio 1998 Riserva (Chianti Classico)
Wine.Description: Bright and intense berry aromas lead into a tart palate that runs heavy with pie cherry and leather. It's probably a tad too tight, tart and hard to merit higher, but with food it should do the trick. Some dark black coffee notes on the finish add to the wine's drying character.

Wine.Name: Palazzo 2011 Brunello di Montalcino
Wine.Description: Charred earth, underbrush, cured meat and toasted hazelnut aromas lift out of the glass. The robust palate is almost overripe, offering dried black cherry, grilled sage, tobacco and a hint of game alongside tightly packed tannins that clench the finish. Drink 2019–2025.

Wine.Name: Casisano Colombaio 2004 Riserva (Brunello di Montalcino)
Wine.Description: This Brunello Riserva opens with a saturated garnet color and segues to aromas of blackberry, cherry, dried currants, leather, tar and Indian spice. There's a very nice juicy or chewy quality to the mouthfeel that gives the wine succulence and substance.

Wine.Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Beaujolais-Villages
Wine.Description: This fine producer, based in Morgon, has made a rich and structured wine. With its perfumed red-berry fruits and balanced acidity, it is a savory wine that is ripe and ready to drink.

Wine.Name: Fattoria Il Colombaio 2012 San Cirino (Chianti Colli Senesi)
Wine.Description: Aromas of toast, espresso, oak and sage come together in the glass. On the palate, notes of coconut and coffee accent a ripe core of wild cherry. Soft acidity and round tannins lend it an easy-drinking quality.

Wine.Name: Weingut Albert Gessinger 2014 Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Josefsberg Old Vines Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
Wine.Description: While shades of slate and saffron lend complexity and nuance, this semisweet wine is more a showcase of sumptuous yellow peach and pear flavors. Its high-toned acidity and delicate, lacy mouthfeel make it irresistibly gulpable.
Wine.Vineyard: Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Josefsberg Old Vines Spätlese

Wine.Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2012 Versace Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
Wine.Description: Funky aromas recall barnyard, wet earth and overripe black fruit. The rustic palate offers mature blackberry and gamy notes alongside fleeting tannins.

Wine.Name: Château de Beaucastel 2005 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
Wine.Description: Think of this wine as a tough, ornery relative who shows great depth once you get to know him. Leather, chocolate and prune notes mark the aromas and flavors, and the wine shows some alcoholic warmth and drying tannins. But the class shows through on the finish, which is long and richly textured. Give it at least another five years in the cellar.

Wine.Name: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Marquês de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)
Wine.Description: This popular brand's white version is soft and smooth. There are some citrus flavors to give the wine a crisp edge, although the main thrust of the wine is more towards apricot and perfumed green plums. Drink now.

Wine.Name: Cesari 2001 Bosan (Amarone della Valpolicella)
Wine.Description: Bosan is a sweet-smelling Amarone with vibrant aromas of blueberry and cherry followed by delicate floral nuances. The wine is direct and immediate with background aromas of red apple, vanilla and oak. It's exceedingly smooth and ends with sweet fruit and soft tannins. An outstanding wine.

Wine.Name: Kirkland Signature 2013 Meritage (Napa Valley)
Wine.Description: A blend of all five red Bordeaux varieties, with Cabernet Sauvignon making up the majority, this wine is simple in structure and softly layered with cherry, vanilla and cola waves.

Wine.Name: 14 Hands 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)
Wine.Description: Reserved aromas of kiwi and banana lead to dry lightly styled grapefruit flavors. The concentration doesn't seem all there.

Wine.Name: Maison Nicolas Perrin 2009 White (Hermitage)
Wine.Description: A blend of 70% Marsanne and 30% Roussanne, this is unusually aromatic for a white Hermitage, with perfumed notes of pineapple and melon underscored by hints of graphite. It's plump on the midpalate and custardy-rich in texture, yet focused and long on the finish. Drink now, or sometime after 2017.

Wine.Name: Drew 2012 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
Wine.Description: This light-colored and easy-drinking wine offers bright cherry and tea aromas followed by raspberry/cranberry flavors on a crisp texture with good acidity and moderate tannins. It shows the leaner side of Pinot.

Wine.Name: Château Roc de Minvielle 2015 Cuvée Les Tourelles (Bordeaux Supérieur)
Wine.Description: This is still a young wine, firm with tannins. The enthusiastic wood aging shows strongly in the smoky toasty flavor. It's hard to find the fruit.

Wine.Name: G. H. Mumm NV Brut Le Rosé (Champagne)
Wine.Description: A finely balanced wine, this is ripe with red fruits and also shot through with acidity and a crisp texture. Together they make for a refreshing, fruity wine. The current release also seems to have just the right bottle age. Drink now.

Wine.Name: Moletto NV Frizzante Prosecco (Marca Trevigiana)
Wine.Description: Delicate and floral, this Prosecco Frizzante delivers less bubbly fizz, offering low key effervescence instead. There are fruity aromas of Golden Delicious apple and pear that give the wine more body and build. Its close is crisp, clean.

Wine.Name: Joseph Cattin NV Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Alsace)
Wine.Description: Strawberry compote on the nose leads to a berry-fruited palate with slightly more tartness: cranberry and red currant come to mind. The flavours are ultrafresh and invigorating, made even more so by the lively frothy fizz. This is joyful, fresh and generous. Drink soon.

Wine.Name: Mahoney 2014 Gavin Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
Wine.Description: Medium bodied and restrained on the palate, this wine offers a mix of caramelized lemon and Gravenstein apple. It ends lengthy with tastes of ginger and lemongrass that leave a refreshing finish.

Wine.Name: Canihan 2010 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
Wine.Description: Very ripe and rich in cherries, cola and sweet red currants, with a jacket of toasty oak. Although this wine is silky in texture, there's a heaviness that makes it Grenache-like. Drink now–2015.

Wine.Name: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2009 Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru (Meursault)
Wine.Description: With its white fruit, lively acidity and delicious ripeness, this is very ready to drink. It's an opulent, rounded wine, with hints of spice to go with its fruit character.
Wine.Vineyard: Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru

Wine.Name: Psagot 2014 Merlot
Wine.Description: This wine offers a delightful bouquet of blackberry and rose petal with touches of salinity. It is smooth and silky at first sip, with flavors of black plum, cherry, chocolate, lavender, and freshly roasted coffee. As it makes its way around the mouth, stern tannins make their presence known and then recede into a finish notable for a lingering espresso bean flavor.
